blogPosts.content: ## Pyx on the Speaker Circuit || Digital Agrifood Summit :::info Pyx's Steve Capell speaks on the future of Verifying Sustainability at the 2024 Digital Agrifood Summit ::: In his role as UN/CEFACT Vice-Chair, PyxGlobal co-founder @Steven Capell spoke at the 2024 Digital Agrifood Summit on the UN Transparency Protocol as the near future of Verifying Sustainability. He participated on a panel alongside representatives from Gundamain Pastoral Co, Greenham, GrainCorp and Deloitte. Verifying Sustainability Session Overview: Australia has a strong reputation of being a clean, green producer of agrifood products. But how do we communicate that on the global stage? This panel discussion explored the various methods that can be used when verifying our sustainability credentials in key export market Congratulations to hosts Food Agility CRC, Charles Sturt University and AgriPark on a successful conference focusing on the challenges and opportunities ahead for Australian agriculture.

prevItem.title: Steve Capell at the 2024 Digital Agrifood Summit

blogPosts.content: ## Pyx Featured in SparkLab Cultiv8's Showcase Accelerator Program :::info Pyx took part in SparkLabs Cultiv8’s 2024 Accelerator Program, culminating in a late-October showcase in Orange, NSW, Australia. ::: Here’s a short video (under 2 minutes) of our CEO, Zachary Zeus, explaining Pyx’s participation in the accelerator program: Pyx was featured as part of SparkLab Cultiv8’s 2024 Showcase because we are pioneering Trust Architecture in Australia's agriculture sector and in the global marketplace. What does that mean? PyxGlobal addresses global supply chain transparency, focused on how organisations share high-quality information so that they can outcompete on the great work that they do for their customers, for their employees, and related to environmental social and governance (ESG) concerns. In the agriculture sector, we’re providing farmers and farms the ability to demonstrate their high-quality goods and services in both domestic and overseas markets through the sharing of ESG / clean and green credentials that they've built over the years. At PyxGlobal, we're working to accelerate a global marketplace where organisations and communities can trade, compete, differentiate, and gain market access based on their sustainability credentials. We're working to enable that information to be shared in a way that provides and creates the incentives for ag sector participants to improve the quality of their carbon tracking and, ultimately, decrease the emissions that they create as part of their production systems. If this is something that sparks your interest or aligns with work you are doing, why not hop on over to the Pyx Community Forum and kick off a discussion about it?

blogPosts.content:
## UNTP 2024 Session 21 Achievements

:::info
Welcome to the Pyx biweekly series, where we share the latest developments in the United Nations Trade Platform (UNTP) from around the world.
:::

#### [1. UNTP Extensions Methodology Published](#untp-extensions-methodology-published)

#### [2. Transmute Achieves UNTP 0.5 Compliance](#transmute-achieves-untp-05-compliance)

### UNTP Extensions Methodology Published

In a significant development, the United Nations Trade Platform (UNTP) has released the first draft of the **Extensions Methodology**. This methodology is designed to enhance the adaptability and interoperability of its core system, setting a standard to accommodate specific industry and regulatory needs while maintaining seamless cross-industry and cross-border compatibility.
<!-- truncate -->

The updated methodology emphasizes open governance, ensuring that all extensions adhere to transparent processes and remain freely available. It outlines comprehensive guidelines for schema and vocabulary extensions, identifier schemes, and conformity criteria, ensuring alignment with relevant standards and regulations.

**From the Article**:

> "UNTP is designed as a common core that is usable by any industry sector or in any regulatory jurisdiction. This extensions methodology describes how to extend UNTP to meet the specific needs of any industry sector or regulated market in such a way that the extension maintains core interoperability with any other extension. This cross-industry and cross-border interoperability is a core value of UNTP because almost every value chain will cross industry and/or national borders."

![Key Highlights](./241031graphic.png)

Key highlights of the release include:
- **New Schema Extensions**: Introduction of additional properties for enhanced flexibility.
- **Industry-Specific Vocabulary**: Use of JSON-LD @context files for customized vocabulary.
- **Identifier Registration**: A clear framework for identifier schemes, promoting standardization.
- **Alignment with Standards Bodies**: Collaboration with organizations like ISO to maintain global compatibility.

UNTP’s commitment to open development is further reinforced through its collaboration with standards bodies, ensuring the platform aligns with global initiatives. This update is expected to foster greater participation from various industry sectors and national projects, solidifying UNTP's role as a vital tool for international trade and cooperation.

For more information, stakeholders are encouraged to review the updated methodology and participate in the ongoing development process. [Read the full methodology here](https://uncefact.github.io/spec-untp/docs/extensions/ExtensionsMethodology/).

Want to discuss what this all means? Join the conversation on the [Pyx Community Forums](https://forum.pyx.io/viewtopic.php?t=16)!

### Transmute Achieves UNTP 0.5 Compliance {#transmute-achieves-untp-05-compliance}

In an outstanding achievement, **Transmute** has become the first solution provider to achieve **UNTP 0.5 Compliance**. Specializing in regulatory compliance for the supply chain, Transmute has integrated key components into their open-standard technology, including:
- **VCP (Verifiable Credentials Protocol)**
- **DPP (Digital Product Passport)**
- **DTE (Digital Traceability Event)**
- **DCC (Digital Conformity Credentials)**

Congratulations to the Transmute team for this major milestone!

[Learn more about Transmute here](https://uncefact.github.io/spec-untp/docs/implementations/Software/#transmute).

frontMatter.title: Pyx Co-Founder Steve Capell Presents UN/CEFACT Recommendation 49

blogPosts.content:
### Pyx Co-Founder Steve Capell Presents UN/CEFACT Recommendation 49

If you're ready to consider and participate in traceability and supply chain transparency at scale, you need to know about the UN Transparency Protocol (UNTP).
<!-- truncate -->
A team of volunteer global experts - including the founders of PyxGlobal - have been supporting UN/CEFACT to develop a new protocol (not a platform, tool or piece of tech) to enable interoperable supply chain traceability and transparency at scale. One fundamental purpose of this protocol is to give greenwashing nowhere to hide.
At PYX, we believe in the power of transparency to revolutionize supply chains and foster trust across industries. Our articles aim to provide you with valuable information, practical insights, and thought-provoking discussions on implementing UNTP and navigating the future of digital trust.

Pyx co-founder, Steven Capell, is a key contributor to the development of UNTP. He's one of the best sources for an explanation about how it is changing the game for governments and industry worldwide as we collectively tackle greenwashing and ESG compliance reporting.

### Transparency at Scale, an overview of United Nations Transparency Protocol and UNECE Recommendation 49
<iframe
  width="560"
  height="315"
  src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dJFryZS2UII"
  title="YouTube video player"
  frameborder="0"
  allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"
  allowFullScreen
>
</iframe>

blogPosts.content:
### Welcome to PYX Articles

Dear Trust Architects and UNTP Enthusiasts,

We are thrilled to welcome you to the PYX Articles section, a hub for news, knowledge and insights dedicated to advances in global trade transparency and sustainability, including the United Nations Transparency Protocol (UNTP) and its transformative impact.
<!-- truncate -->
### Our Vision

At PYX, we believe in the power of transparency to revolutionise supply chains and foster trust across industries. Our articles aim to provide you with valuable information and practical insights to instigate thought-provoking discussions on implementing UNTP and navigating the future of digital trust.

### What You'll Find Here

- In-depth analyses of UNTP implementation strategies
- Case studies showcasing successful UNTP adoption
- Expert opinions on the latest developments in supply chain transparency
- Insights on the intersection of technology, trade, and sustainability
- News regarding efforts and advances in global supply chain transparency
- Pyx News and Updates

### Join the Conversation

We encourage you to engage with our content, share your thoughts, and contribute to the growing community of Trust Architects. Your experiences and perspectives are invaluable in shaping the future of global trade transparency.

Follow this [link to the forums](https://forum.pyx.io/) which we created for us to collaborate!

Thank you for being part of this journey towards a more transparent and sustainable global economy.

Warm regards,

Zachary Zeus
*Co-Founder/CEO, PYX Global*

Chris Gough
*Co-Founder, PYX Global*

Steve Capell
*Co-Founder, PYX Global*
